info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:07PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Henrico County and the City of Richmond through 445 PM EDT... At 407 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Virginia Commonwealth University, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Virginia Union University, Highland Springs, Virginia Commonwealth University, University Of Richmond, Mechanicsville, Bon Air, Tuckahoe, Laurel, East Highland Park, Lakeside, Glen Allen, Bensley, Richmond Heights, Montrose, Solomons Store, Chamberlayne, Greendale and Dumbarton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
